medical_history.chief_complaint: Patient presents with nonhealing fractures and low serum alkaline phosphatase levels due to adult hypophosphatasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms include a waddling gait since 2001, a comminuted left femoral fracture in August 2007 from minimal trauma, and pain in the back and hips. Pseudofractures were noted bilaterally on the proximal femurs in early 2007. Treatment with teriparatide was initiated 4 months after surgery for the left femoral fracture. Healing of the pseudofracture was observed after 8 months of teriparatide treatment, but biochemical markers returned to baseline between 8 and 13 months of treatment despite good compliance.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past history includes 'soft teeth' since childhood, a left wrist fracture in 1990, and a thoracic vertebral fracture in 2002; both latter fractures healed normally. Persistent low serum ALP levels ranging from 3 to 8 IU/liter since 2002.
medical_history.family_history: Unremarkable; none of her siblings had fractures or premature loss of teeth. Both parents had 'bad teeth.'
